alert.note: Alert for Mason (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 24 at 11:49AM PST until December 25 at 5:34PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Seattle WA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Washington... Skokomish River At Potlatch affecting Mason County. .Heavy rain and high snow levels will drive the Skokomish River in Mason County above flood stage today. The river is expected to fall slightly below flood stage Sunday but then more flooding is likely early next week as additional wet weather systems move through.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. WAC045-250400- /O.NEW.KSEW.FL.W.0074.221224T2108Z-221226T0134Z/ /SRPW1.2.ER.221224T2108Z.221225T0600Z.221225T1633Z.NO/ 1149 AM PST Sat Dec 24 2022 ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Skokomish River at Potlatch. * WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 17.5 feet, the Skokomish River will cause moderate flooding, with deep and quick flood waters inundating some residential areas, many roads, and much of the farm land in the Skokomish Valley. Inundated roads include the Skokomish Valley road, Bourgault Road West, Purdy Cutoff Road, and Highway 106. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM PST Saturday the stage was 16.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 17.6 feet late this evening. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 16.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.6 feet on 10/20/2003. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
